refnamediv.refpurpose: Throws an exception when a program invariant is violated

refentry.refsect1:
&reftitle.description;
voidinvariant_violation stringformat mixed...
invariant_violation throws an exception when a program invariant is violated. If a handler has been registered with invariant_callback_register, that callback is called with the same set of arguments passed to invariant_violation. If a callback has not been defined, or if that callback returns, an exception of type InvariantException is thrown with its message set to the sprintf of the arguments passed to invariant_violation.
The recommended use of invariant and invariant_violation are only to indicate programmer error for conditions that should never occur. Their error handling semantics are likely too coarse for general use.
The Hack typechecker is aware that invariant_violation can never return and always throws, and takes this into account in its program flow analysis.
